programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Auctions in Costa Mesa bring out the best and worst in the buyers as they go all out to score a fortune from a great locker.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: There are fierce negotiations for an American Civil War musket and Corey feels the brunt of his father's anger when he sells a rare poster from his movie collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer brings in a ticket to the Beatles' 1966 concert at New York's Shea Stadium, and the team plans a birthday surprise.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick gets the chance to restore a Nasa jet pack signed by Buzz Aldrin and a client brings in a Second World War bomb.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick turns a cigarette machine into a device for holding bike tools, and Tyler plans to buy a rare 1950s pedal-powered bulldozer.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The risks involved in the job are evident when a friend of one of the driver's loses a leg in a towing accident. Meanwhile, tow man Jamie realises he has a rival on the highway.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Jarrett takes his new rig on its first assignment, only to find it is loaded with flamethrowers, and Roy has to ask Jennifer for help.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Marc is held on the sidelines with big rig repairs until his friend joins in the bidding, but everyone else gets the last laugh when he's forced to rent a box truck. Chris transports a boat by sea, while Robbie drives by land to the drop off. However, things get tense when Chris' cute shipmates seem too distracting.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: A woman's body is found dumped on a Wisconsin highway and investigators suspect the murder is a result of a lovers' argument turned deadly. Challenging investigations in modern law enforcement, profiling completed cases that were far from straightforward.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Ponytail clashes with drivers outside a mosque, and Brian meets a group of attractive women.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Two clampers meet an unexpected fan while on patrol, and a parking warden with a bad reputation gets into a heated argument during rush hour.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Strange objects above Sweden, a UFO over Portugal and an extraordinary 'mass-sighting' of strange luminous phenomena in a remote Italian village.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked with forging blades out of steel from a chain and a sprocket. Only two secure a spot in the final round to recreate the iconic Karabela sabre.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked to forge J Nielson's favourite blade, a Damascus European dagger, before moving on to the Zande spear.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: At the new shop, the Golds are surprised to find a bag of gems inside a former employee's desk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Former employee Tressa returns to sell the Rolex that got her sacked and Les struggles to control the situation when insults start to fly between her and Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes on the rampage when he finds out a thief has been on the premises, and a customer selling a guitar signed by Kid Rock reveals a valuable secret.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor's bidding war with Ricky and Bubba continues at Fort Worth, where he seeks an ally. Meanwhile, other buyers find they might be better off working alone.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Texarkana in search of new territory. Slick Vic uncovers some action figures, and Ricky and Bubba find an unforgettable antique.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The big money buyers find themselves out of their comfort zones in DeSoto, and a new face from across the pond threatens to ruin Ricky and Bubba's day.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders return to Dallas hoping to land a locker of a lifetime, and Mary flouts the law in her eagerness to score a dream unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Auctions in Garland bring a day of dashed hopes and sweet profits. Plus, a new buyer begins to throw some of the bidders off their game.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers head to Fort Worth, where a local auctioneer stirs up trouble when he joins as bidder.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a cavalry jacket from the American Civil War, and a book signed by vaudeville performer and silent-film star Will Rogers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a wanted poster of John Wilkes Booth, the actor who assassinated Abraham Lincoln.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over a First World War helmet and a holster from the TV series Gunsmoke, while Rick decides they need to get into shape.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team members get their hands on an 1863 rifle that proved decisive in the American Civil War, and examine a fully restored 1915 Ford Model T taxi.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys race to check out a motorbike once owned by The Great Escape actor Steve McQueen. They also encounter a rare shotgun disguised as a cane.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a first-edition copy of an Ernest Hemingway novel and a 1932 Lincoln Roadster, and discover the story behind an unusual belt-buckle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers cast their eyes over a car-load of signed Star Trek memorabilia and an antique cannon from 1980s TV series Magnum, PI.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The buyers are impressed by a script for The Godfather signed by Al Pacino, and consider buying a coin-operated children's ride from the 1950s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: There are fierce negotiations for an American Civil War musket and Corey feels the brunt of his father's anger when he sells a rare poster from his movie collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer brings in a ticket to the Beatles' 1966 concert at New York's Shea Stadium, and the team plans a birthday surprise.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates whether alien encounters influenced the establishing acts of the Founding Fathers as he travels to Washington, DC.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: New evidence uncovered at Smith's Cove brings the fellowship closer to deciphering the purpose of the mysterious U-shaped structure. Plus, a previously undiscovered formation seems likely to lead to the island's legendary flood tunnels.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty Lagina make a discovery at Smith's Cove that promises to help them solve the mystery of the Money Pit.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A ship from the 23rd century is washed up from the past and the Dwarfers run into a crew where criticism is illegal. When they protest they are arrested and threatened with draining of all critical thoughts. However, Rimmer's bitterness about his childhood comes in handy in beating the draining machine, his inner critic and the system, at least for a while. Johnny Vegas guest stars.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe and Miles Jupp join Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for a July 2012 edition of the comedy panel show taking a look back at the week's news.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Compilation looking back at highlights of past episodes of the comedy quiz hosted by Dara O Briain, with regular panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison. From 2012.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: James Acaster, Kate Williams, Ed Balls and Lauren Laverne join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Comedy about a wannabe doctor who starts work as a hospital porter, but a mix-up forces him to pose as a real medic. Starring Ed Easton and Rutger Hauer. In the first episode, Simon arrives for his first day and stands out like a sore thumb, much to the amusement of his mentors Frankie and Tillman.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Simon is still coping with his unrequited love for nurse Lucy, and seeing her swoon over Doctor McKenzie prompts him to offer an unnecessary kidney transplant to a young patient. Meanwhile, Frankie steals a recently deceased patient's winning lottery ticket, but Tillman warns that karma will be out to rebalance the universe.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Simon sees a fast-track management scheme as a way to escape portering. Frankie - who is fired - and Tillman - who is tasered - are miffed.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond and James May try to make a space shuttle out of a Reliant Robin, while Jeremy Clarkson puts the Porsche 911 Turbo through its paces. The Stig takes to the track in a Mercedes SL, and actor Simon Pegg opts for a more modest vehicle as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Celebrity Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Ricky Grover, Steph and Dom from Gogglebox, Union J, Shappi Khorsandi, Dave Gorman, Katy Brand and Charlotte Hawkins take part in Ipswich.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys pick the collection of a reclusive and mysterious businessman named 'the Colonel', who has gone to great lengths to keep his identity secret.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys go hog wild at a sprawling ranch in Texas, where Mike flips for a VW bus that has been transformed into a hunting lodge on wheels.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team are venturing into the heart of Suriname, to kayak an unnamed river that will take the them through a forest unchanged for millions of years.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Police officers investigate an attack on a pizza delivery driver and find a woman sleeping in the garden of an abandoned house.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: Before lights out to start the Formula 1 season in Australia, the programme gains access behind the scenes at F1 team Haas as they pack tonnes of cars and gear for air freighting.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond and James May try to make a space shuttle out of a Reliant Robin, while Jeremy Clarkson puts the Porsche 911 Turbo through its paces. The Stig takes to the track in a Mercedes SL, and actor Simon Pegg opts for a more modest vehicle as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters square up to their Australian counterparts in an automotive version of the Ashes, with challenges including rallying, drifting and a double-decker car race. Jeremy Clarkson also test-drives the Ferrari 599 GTO, and Boris Becker gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Strongman Eddie meets - and eats - gators roaming the Everglades, tests his grappling skills with WWE legends The Headbangers, and tries to devour a kitchen sink full of ice-cream.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie visits the Garden State for supersized breakfast in a New Jersey diner, a tryout with ice hockey pros the NJ Devils - and an epic struggle with an eight-hot-dog challenge.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Dave Gorman and Omid Djalili, TV presenter Davina McCall and journalist Janet Street-Porter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic cycling gold-medallist Chris Hoy, impressionist Ronni Ancona, writer and producer Danny Wallace and sports presenter Gabby Logan join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Fashionista Trinny Woodall, actor Reece Shearsmith, West End star Michael Ball and critic Charlie Brooker join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are trying to make the family healthier, so they are not too happy about the school lollipop man handing out sweets to the kids. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites Rose Matafeo, Phil Wang and Marcus Brigstocke to help him make sense of our insensible world.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe and Miles Jupp join Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for a July 2012 edition of the comedy panel show taking a look back at the week's news.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Compilation looking back at highlights of past episodes of the comedy quiz hosted by Dara O Briain, with regular panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison. From 2012.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Exploring UFO sightings over Canada and the US during both World Wars and theories that Churchill knew about the attack on Pearl Harbor before it happened.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: Hitler v Churchill: The Eagle and the Lion
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary exploring the rivalry between the leaders of Britain and Germany during the Second World War, and their common experiences during the First World War.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: The relatives of a wireless operator, a passenger and a steward discover how their ancestors' lives intertwined on board the ill-fated Titanic in 1912. Presented by Chris Hollins.

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: Chris Hollins invites three people, including the nephew and grandson of two RAF pilots, learn about the role their forebears played in the Battle of Britain.

programme.title: Flying Scotsman with Robson Green
programme.desc: The presenter spends a year working with the team of engineers who have been commissioned to rebuild the most famous steam engine in the world. Starting in February, Robson is given the task of cutting off the front end of the Scotsman and welding on a whole piece, and sets out to Durham, where he discovers how the invention of the steam engine helped to change the world. After a year in the workshop, the iconic train is ready for its first test run, and Robson realises a lifelong dream and gets to ride on the footplate as it sets off.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston talks to author Joy Hancox about the alchemical roots of London, the design of famous buildings such as The Globe theatre and the mysterious figure of English poet John Byrom. He also meets a modern day potion-maker.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: The documentary exploring historical mysteries returns, beginning with Jamie Theakston looking at the lost city of Petra in Jordan. The presenter questions whether any treasures still lie beneath the site in hidden tombs, and enlists the help of local historians.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates one of history's most enduring mysteries as he goes on a world-wide search for the Holy Grail, visiting Glastonbury in Somerset, Wales, Valencia in Spain, and New York City to inspect four goblets that could be the ancient relic.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Documentary about the change of musical direction in 1978, when pop singles were slowly ousted by disco, punk and new wave artists. The programme features contributions by members of the Boomtown Rats, Squeeze, Boney M and Sham 69 - among others - and archive performances by the likes of Elvis Costello, the Undertones, Ian Dury and the Blockheads and the Jam.

programme.title: The Rolling Stones at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the band's performances from the BBC archives, in a programme originally broadcast in 2012 to celebrate their 50th anniversary. Songs include The Last Time, Let's Spend The Night Together, Get Off of My Cloud, Honky Tonk Women, Gimme Shelter, Miss You and Start Me Up. Plus, footage of the band performing 19th Nervous Breakdown on Top of the Pops in 1966, which was used in a 1960s BBC documentary about women with depression.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Leo visits old college friend Sean Delaney at his psychiatric care centre in Essex, where one of the patients has been found dead in her bed. Although the coroner ruled a verdict of sudden-death syndrome, Delaney is not convinced and asks Leo to investigate. Suspicion soon falls on the dead girl's father, who has lost the family fortune, and his wife - but the pathologist runs into problems when the local detective sergeant makes it clear she is suspicious of his motives. Adrian Dunbar, Tamzin Outhwaite and Tom Ellis guest star.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The net starts to tighten around Ralph Saroyan when more is discovered about his secret financial dealings. Meanwhile, Evie's affair with Treasury Minister Lord Montford threatens the future of the company, and Bea's marriage continues to flounder.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice leaves Jack and moves in with Evie, while the General Strike threatens the future of the new collection. Starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A robbery at the local museum sets Lovejoy off on the trail of a hoard of Roman coins hidden on the Isle of Man - but he soon discovers two Americans are also searching for it. Drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A bereaved couple hire Lovejoy to find a pair of Regency duelling pistols and bring about the downfall of a murderer - but to complete the task he is forced to risk Jane's life and fight a duel. Anthony Valentine guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is drawn into a serious family dispute by an American woman who believes her father murdered her mother and wants him deported back to Florida to stand trial. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim agrees to chauffeur Charlie to an 80th birthday party in France that turns out to be more eventful than he anticipated. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Humiliated that Sir Henry Simmerson has allowed the French to make off with an English standard, Sharpe vows to make amends by capturing the most jealously guarded battlefield prize of them all - a French eagle emblem touched by the hand of Napoleon himself. Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Brian Cox star.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Crime author Jack Rudd visits Brokenwood to give a reading at the local book club - but he never leaves, falling victim to a method of murder portrayed in his own book.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The detective investigates a murder connected to vaudeville entertainers Harry and Al Jolson, while Watts unravels a mystery about his own family.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.desc: Frankie suspects sabotage when a baseball player dies mid-game, but her investigation puts her at odds with ruthless mobster Bessie Starkman. Crime drama, starring Lauren Lee Smith.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: When Penny's (Hayley McElhinney) away on honeymoon Hugh (Rodger Corser) and Tara (Kate Jenkinson) come out to play, with a little help from Charlie (Nicole da Silva) their night takes a dramatic turn as Hugh loses more than his sobriety.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: April is pregnant, and not everyone is as supportive as Matt had hoped, but the netball game between the hospital and mining company takes all the focus.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness presents the show in which a group of men enters the 'love lift' in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Today's contestants are a carnival dancer, a magician, a city worker and a sports therapist.

programme.title: Bang on the Money
programme.desc: Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom host the game show in which two teams of friends must battle it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges. At the end of the contest, the most successful group could win up to 40,000. Taking part this time round are Tanz & Bantz from Essex, and the Bowling Stones from Newcastle.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Ahead of the General Election, Ranvir Singh talks to Nicola Sturgeon, leader of the Scottish Nationalist Party. She also interviews the co-leader of the Green Party Sin Berry. Plus, Jonathan Hill meets Plaid Cymru leader Adam Price.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Dino Dana
programme.desc: It's a two part special, and Dana has made her own board game so that the whole family can learn about what happened to the Dinosaurs after a meteorite ended their kind.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A brilliant inventor plans to launch his newly constructed Hyperloop with a trial run, but when the machine begins to malfunction mid-circuit, it is up to Scott to find a way to slow it down. Animated adventure, with the voice of David Tennant.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Fast flowing waters await Danny in today's dare as he takes on a white-water rafting course including the UK's steepest man-made drop..

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel are after the president's jokebook. But Magoo, thinking he's in his dojo, enters the high-security unit where it's kept....

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is on his way to the seaside when the mini runs out of petrol. Undeterred he manages to get a push, but for some reason the do-gooders don't want to push him all the way to the beach!.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave is given a bulb to grow. Popping it in his lunch box, it isn't long before he discovers it's partial to Betty's sandwiches..

programme.title: LEGO Jurassic World: The Legend of Isla Nublar
Mighty Magiswords!
programme.desc: Prohyas and Vambre attempt to tame two of their most problematic Magiswords - Taunting Jester and Carnivorous Plant - with the help of Kablammica..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The TV chef is joined in the kitchen by husband and wife 1980s singers Martin and Shirlie Kemp, who have recently collaborated on an album of swing covers, as well as chef Stephen Terry and forager Alysia Vasey. Plus, Oz Clarke shares his tips on the best wine for a Christmas party and continues his tour of Britain's best pubs.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the next leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo boards an old steam train run by ex-railroad men and volunteers which takes him through the beautiful Tuscan countryside. His first stop is the town of Asciano, where locals try to compete with Siena's famous Palio horse race - only here they ride donkeys. Then it's on to the Chianti region where he visits a vineyard where they don't only make wine, but they also bathe in it too, an ancient tradition dating back to Roman times. After a luxurious wine bath, Gino cooks up a dish fit for any Emperor - farfalle pasta with funghi and spinach.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha re-creates the family feasts of China with chef Jeremy Pang. The menu comprises the street food snack jianbing for breakfast, prawn toasts with smacked cucumber for lunch, Jeremy's claypot chicken and mushroom rice for lunch and Nadia's banana fritters for dessert.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Newbury
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 3.00 Ladbrokes Trophy Steeple Chase, and races at 1.50, 2.25 and 3.40 from Newbury, Plus, races at 2.05 and 3.20 from Newcastle. With analysis from Ruby Walsh and AP McCoy, reports by Luke Harvey, Mick Fitzgerald, Alice Plunkett, Rishi Persad, Matt Chapman and Oli Bell, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs & Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. In the sixth episode, the comedian meets an albino Pekingese riddled with health problems, and in need of an operation on his eye, which is making it difficult for him to find a new home. Meanwhile, a dog rescued from a near death experience in the Thames needs help overcoming his nerves, and a Labrador puppy arrives with a mystery illness affecting his lungs.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as impressionist Rory Bremner, weather reporter Laura Tobin, Dragons' Den's Deborah Meaden and TV gardener and chat show host Alan Titchmarsh pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The latest group of men to enter the 'love lift' are a Bruno Mars impersonator, a duck lover, a serial dater and a skip driver, who pull out all the stops in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Paddy McGuinness presents.

programme.title: The X Factor: Celebrity
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary hosts the climax of the star-studded spin-off from the long-running singing contest. Over the past seven weeks, the line-up of famous faces has been whittled down to today's finalists, all under the watchful mentoring of judging panel Simon Cowell, Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh. In this grand final, they will perform to impress both the viewing public and the judges, with the most popular act being crowned as the first celebrity series champion and securing a recording contract.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the latest episode of the celebrity survival challenge, with the campmates facing the prospect of their third week in the jungle, with more tough daily tasks and dreaded Bushtucker Trials ahead of them - and for some, a ticket home.

programme.desc: The host is joined by guests tennis champion Andy Murray, Luke Evans, recently seen in Second World War drama Midway, doctor-turned-comic and author of bestseller This is Going to Hurt Adam Kay, and comedian Desiree Burch. programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a V8-powered Land Rover Defender for less than 5,000, that modifications expert Edd China can turn into a modern urban vehicle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and mechanic Edd China sets about mending it. They then take the car to Exmoor for a final test drive before looking for a buyer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an old Range Rover Mk3 for a bargain price, hoping Edd China can renovate it and have it resprayed white in order to pass it on for double the amount he paid.

programme.desc: Mike Kennedy goes underwater in Florida to seize a seaplane, while Ken Cage and Danny Thompson chase a debtor who has been fooling them with phony flight plans.

programme.desc: Experts discuss aviation disasters that were caused by design flaws, including a jumbo jet that exploded in mid-flight and DC10 aircraft that fell from the sky.

programme.desc: Trucking legend Steve and his dog Bella take a huge load cross-country from Alice Springs to Perth. Meanwhile, engine issues see Russell struggle to hit a delivery deadline.

programme.title: Combat Dealers

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a clean Subaru Impreza WRX at a good price, and hands it to Edd China to make it stand out by giving it a performance boost and changing its appearance.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits the Lambretta Scooter Museum in Weston-super-Mare, and in Walsall, West Midlands, there is a historic haul in one of the UK's last leather factories.

programme.desc: Colin Murray presents a round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A series of bank robberies in Texas leaves police baffled, but when similar crimes begin in California the next year the FBI are quick to make a connection.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic sculptors can create a face in the likeness of a victim, often leading to the naming of unidentified corpses.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A case in which a husband and respected businessman left his home one morning and never returned. Investigators contemplated whether a business deal 'gone sour' was to blame. Plus, a case in which a young mother vanished while searching for work. Officers relied on surveillance cameras to provide them a lead to her whereabouts.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which two young women failed to return home from the local drive-thru. As their parents began a search for them, a fisherman gave police their first clue.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents search for a young girl abducted on a camping trip - and their investigation is helped by the numerous phone calls the kidnapper makes to the victim's mother.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is called to Cairns Rainforest Station Nature Park to check on the broken jaw of Agro the crocodile, who has managed to kill all nine of the other crocs in his pond.

programme.desc: Pluto the singing dog is having problems with his voice, causing concern for Dr Chris. Tim tackles a territorial Tasmanian Devil, and can Lisa save a desperately ill kitten?.

programme.desc: At over 700lbs, Teretha's life is confined to a bed. Her family fears losing her and hopes a gastric bypass will provide the solution she needs to save her life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman who weighs 700 pounds is completely dependent on her husband and lives in constant fear that she will die, so tries to change her diet prior to gastric surgery.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of Octavia, who was bedbound for nearly a year before seeking help. With her best friend also her worst enabler, can she choose between old habits and a new life?.

programme.desc: Erin wants a blue dress for her wedding, but must persuade her sceptical entourage, while Kate goes in search of a unique gown.
